name: Companies with worldwide, domestic, and foreign R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by source of funds, industry, and company size: 2018
description: Companies with worldwide, domestic, and foreign R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by source of funds, industry, and company size: 2018

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_worldwide_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_company
variableMeasured.description: Worldwide R D Performance Paid For By Company

variableMeasured.name: field_worldwide_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Worldwide R D Performance Paid For By Others

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_company
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Performance Paid For By Company

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Performance Paid For By Others

variableMeasured.name: field_foreign_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_company
variableMeasured.description: Foreign R D Performance Paid For By Company

variableMeasured.name: field_foreign_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Foreign R D Performance Paid For By Others

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Beginning in survey year 2018, statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded $50,000 or more of R&D. This change has affected the comparability of these estimates with estimates published for years prior to 2018. Statistics are based on companies in the United States that reported to the survey. No systematic item imputation was applied. Beginning in survey year 2018, these statistics include an adjustment to the weight to account for unit nonresponse. A company having multiple reporting parts for data collection may contribute to the statistics for multiple industries, so the detail may not add to the total for the number of companies.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and U.S. Census Bureau, Business Research and Development Survey, 2018.
